name: 葛瑞斐
objective: In this course, students will write, shoot, act in, and edit their own film.  In preparation for such a project, we will discuss the basics of film theory and editing, emphasizing the special nature of film – what makes it distinct from other art forms – as a unique combination of image, word, and sound.  The script for this semester’s film will be an original story inspired by Dante’s The Divine Comedy, the classic Western text about a journey through heaven and hell.
schedule:
Week 1  Intro
		Production assignments

Week 2  Basics of Film Theory 1:  Image, Word, and Sound
		
Week 3:  Basics of Film Theory 2:  Using the Camera

Week 4:  Script review and production meeting (locations, set design, costumes)

Weeks 5-12  Shooting schedule

Weeks 13-17   Editing
